summary: This bill, the Frederick Douglass Trafficking Victims Prevention and Protection Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. It focuses on combating human trafficking both domestically and internationally. Key provisions include modifications to grants for trafficking recognition and prevention education, establishing a Human Trafficking Survivors Employment and Education Program, amendments to tier standards for countries, and clarifying non-humanitarian foreign assistance. The bill also authorizes appropriations for various programs related to trafficking prevention and victim support. It seeks to improve data collection, reporting, and interagency collaboration to address trafficking effectively.
